snippet: A report released by the National Hurricane Center on Tuesday charged that downgrading Hurricane Sandy to a post-tropical cyclone limited the warnings that weather forecasters could issue.
abstract: National Hurricane Center report charges downgrading Hurricane Sandy to post-tropical cyclone limited warnings that weather forecasters could issue; proposes changing warning system so it could continue to issue formal advisories on post-tropical cyclones as long as those systems pose a significant threat.
lead_paragraph: A report released by the National Hurricane Center on Tuesday charged that downgrading Hurricane Sandy to a post-tropical cyclone limited the warnings that weather forecasters could issue.

headline.seo: Reducing Hurricane Sandy to a Tropical Storm Undercut Warnings
headline.main: Hurricane Center Seeks Expanded Authority to Issue Warnings
headline.print_headline: Hurricane’s Downgrade Undercut Warnings, Report Finds
